intro: Daviesia villifera, commonly known as the silky hakea, is a flowering plant native to south-eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers in late winter to early spring, which are clustered in spherical or cylindrical inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Daviesia villifera is adapted to dry conditions and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
